channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: This Week in Explainers: Ghaziabad sisters’ suicide and the K-wave overwhelming India
Pakistan mosque blast: Did a suicide bomber detonate explosives after being halted by guards?
RFK Jr claims keto diet can ‘cure schizophrenia’. What does science say?
Will Japan PM Sanae Takaichi's gamble of a snap election pay off?
Is North Korea ‘executing’ children for watching Squid Game, listening to K-pop?
Why are Hindus in Bangladesh fearful ahead of February 12 elections?
Saving the dollar: Why Trump’s India deal matters more to the US
item.description: Why Trump did the deal with India may have nothing to do with agriculture or Russian oil, and everything to do with the dollar

item.title: Shadow Warrior | Why Trump’s claims on the India-US trade deal cannot be taken at face value
item.description: There has been no Indian readout corroborating a number of Donald Trump’s claims, especially on agriculture, which is a red line, a no-go, for India

item.title: India-Seychelles at 50: President Harminie’s Delhi visit opens avenues for strategic convergence, maritime security
item.description: Seychelles is not merely a passive arena of great-power competition in the Indian Ocean but an active strategic negotiator whose choices are central to India’s maritime security vision

item.title: How US’ Pax Silica is India’s golden opportunity
item.description: The February 4 US-organised ministerial on critical minerals was less an endpoint than a beginning. For India, the participation reinforces its ambition to emerge as a key node in global technology and resource networks

item.title: From tariff to trust: How India and United States reset trade and ties
item.description: The India-US trade deal is a strategic reset that significantly lowers trade barriers for Indian exporters and strengthens the bilateral economic partnership

item.title: Kashmir Solidarity Day: How Pakistan is trying to mask its terror image post Operation Sindoor
item.description: The February 5 spectacle appears less like an expression of solidarity and more like a hurried and desperate attempt to recast a state widely known as the ‘mothership of terrorism’ into a self-styled champion of Kashmiri rights.
